data.title: dotnet F5 build task issue
data.body:
Note sure if this is for VS Code or the c# extension

My environment:

- VSCode Version:1.14.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04.2 LTS
- dotnet core Version: 2.0.0-preview2-006497
- c# Extension for VS Code Version: 1.11.0

Steps to Reproduce:

1.dotnet new console
2.code .
3. F5 to launch
4. Picked .NET core as environment
5. Fixed the path to include the output dll i.e. netcoreapp2.0/app.dll in the .vscode/launch.json file
6. F5 to launch
7. Picked .NET Core as the task 
8. F5 to launch

I get a "Error The preLaunchTask 'build' terminated with exit code 129."

The generated tasks.json file content is

```
{
    // See https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=733558
    // for the documentation about the tasks.json format
    "version": "2.0.0",
    "tasks": [
        {
            "taskName": "build",
            "command": "dotnet",
            "type": "shell",
            "group": "build",
            "presentation": {
                "reveal": "silent"
            },
            "problemMatcher": "$msCompile"
        }
    ]
}
```

I needed to change the following content to include the build command

```
            "command": "dotnet",
```

```
            "command": "dotnet build",
```

Should this not be the default ?

data.title: Markdown Fenced Code Block Highlighting Wrong
data.body:
[CommonMark Specification](http://spec.commonmark.org/0.27/#code-fence):
> A code fence is a sequence of at least three consecutive backtick characters (`) or tildes (~). (**Tildes and backticks cannot be mixed.**)

[Our Implementation](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/32566fd1f1959de84a98be06fcfcd397ad729ead/extensions/markdown/syntaxes/markdown.tmLanguage.base#L414):

``` regex
(^|\G)(\s*)([`~]{3,})\s*(?=([^`~]*)?$)
```

Code snippet to reproduce(syntax highlighting is missing after line 2, Markdown preview works as expected):
``` markdown
`/` represents the **root directory**.
`~` represents your **home directory**.
And `.` represents the **current working directory**.
```

data.title: Visual Studio Code bug
data.body:
Im new to web development and I just installed Visual Studio Code. I installed some extensions. I'm bothered and annoyed when suddenly some very long text automatically inserted in my code. It start in the end tag of html(). It is very long so im just gonna show here some of it.

when encoutered I just delete it but it comes back every a couple of minute or so. Please help I do not know what to do to fix/avoid/stop this.

Kindly view my attached photo to see what im talking about.

data.title: Support relative paths in .code-workspace files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.15.0-insider (9912a545c9728ce5e6b3cdfcc9442ee47955aa42, 2017-07-21T05:16:15.475Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063

---

I'd like to be able to share a `.code-workspace` file in a Git repo. For that, the file paths have to be relative. It seems this already _sort of_ works if you manually edit the file to use relative file URIs starting with `file:./`. However, that seems to make the path relative to the VSCode installation dir, rather than the directory that contains the workspace file:

![](http://i.imgur.com/p1HnRg0.png)

```json
{
	"id": "1500632094036",
	"folders": [
		"file:./TestProject"
	]
}
```

data.title: Selecting left to right gives different completion results than right to left
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Select text from left to right and trigger completion
2. Notice options in completion (only one option)
3. Select text from right to left and trigger completion
4. Notice options in completion  (multiple options)

![vscode-selection](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/576184/28457717-815b5e34-6e07-11e7-91a6-be021a8a606b.gif)

I'm not very used to vscode yet, but it feels weird that the direction of the selection makes a difference for the completion results. Double clicking (which I mostly do to select a text) seems to the same select from left to right. 

I don't get the completion results in both cases, its somewhat pointless to show the same thing if there is one result. But the other results give me almost everything in the context without selecting what I have right now.

Expected result:

* I would expect both to have the full context options
* I would expect both to have the current selection also selected in the completion (in this case the completion menu should scroll down and select "UIButton").

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Haven't tried. I use vshaxe 1.9.0, but also seems to happen in typescript.

data.title: Running a launch config with a missing "request" attribute fails silently
data.body:
I was just bitten by this:
Running a debug session that is missing the "request" attribute fails silently and the only indication is the tiny green squiggly:

![2017-07-21_11-20-23](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1898161/28457983-55984c66-6e08-11e7-8271-0264bb76581e.png)

Since the "request" attribute is mandatory I suggest that we show an error notification like the one for an unknown debug type.


![2017-07-21_11-34-45](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1898161/28458065-9f9c880e-6e08-11e7-8d56-3a2d0f83af06.png)

1. have lots of stuff in the tree so that a scrollbar shows up

data.title: JS syntax highlighting breaks when quoted property name and left parenthesis in value
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:34:09.706Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601

Object's property name in quotes (ex.:'--file') and left parenthesis ('(') in value break the JS syntax in subsequent code.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open JS file with following code:

(with left parenthesis and quoted name) - broken
![synth0](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1925433/28454104-49564dc6-6dfa-11e7-981e-5cf387c8147a.PNG)
(without left parenthesis)
![synth1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1925433/28454387-639e6adc-6dfb-11e7-8097-7eff303647bc.PNG)

Works when bracket notation is used. :+1: 
![synth](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1925433/28454105-495eac8c-6dfa-11e7-99ac-04450a81c05c.PNG)

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

This code worked with 1.13

data.title: Marketplace rendering of images from README decodes URL characters
data.body: Apologies, I don't know if this is the best place to raise this; feel free to point me elsewhere! In [my readme](https://github.com/Dart-Code/Dart-Code/blob/master/README.md) I have an image with an encoded ampersand (%26) in the URL. It renders correctly on GitHub but on the marketplace is has been decoded to an ampersand in the source, which result in it not being rendered correctly (note it says `Mac` instead of `Mac & Linux`).

data.title: Need stash save/pop in git module
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: Win7
- OS Version: 1.15.0 Insiders

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Change `A.ts` `B.ts` 2 files
2. Commit `A.ts` 
3. Wanna sync with remote (rebase and push)
4. Cannot rebase (for there is unstaged changes)

To do the same things in TortoiseGit, it can stash save -> rebase -> stash pop automatically.
Hope have this feature in vscode git.

Once in this situation in vscode , I could only switch to TortoiseGit to finish rebase.

data.title: Additionally open an unnecessary page when using VScode as the default editor of cscope
data.body:
<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: lastest Linux version
- OS Version: elementaryOS Loki 0.4.1

Steps to Reproduce:

I've set VScode as the default editor when I want to open the file searched from cscope.
By adding the following line into ~/.bashrc:
`export CSCOPE_EDITOR=code`

1. The figure below is a scenario of using cscope at the build-in terminal of VScode, which before opening a file.  
[Figure 1](http://imgur.com/y5fLQmY)

2. And then I pressed number "2" to open the file, it would open the target-file but also an unnecessary file. In this case, the filename was "113", which was the line number showed on cscope screen.
[Figure 2](http://imgur.com/zWlPTt1)

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Error with Inputing Chinese
data.body:
Hi, I set a keybing to my Chinese IME, so I can use control+H to delete wrong characters, and I meet some problems when using vscode.
First I input some characters and get the input candidates, and then I hit control+H in suppose to delete the wrong character, but the ones I've input before are deleted.
The GIF can help you understand my idea.I've input "你好世界" already, then I input "ni hao" and get the character candidates, when I want to delete "ni hao", I got "你好世界" deleted too.
![ezgif com-video-to-gif](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6948576/28449680-7b7b1fb0-6e14-11e7-9e08-90cd34b89722.gif)

data.title:
HTML ident/autoformatting handling
tags: please keep/add new lines
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.0 (b8cd5b9556d8b70ea560d35b903422363f6c5c40, 2017-07-10T20:36:40.018Z) - OS Version: Linux x64 4.11.9-300.fc26.x86_64 - Extensions: Extension|Author (truncated)|Version ---|---|--- vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11 pgsql|dou|0.0.8 debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.1.6 vscode-sql-beautify|sen|0.0.4 --- Steps to Reproduce: 1. Enable "Format On Save" by setting "editor.formatOnSave": true 2. create test.html 3. write this code (don't save) ```
Some text
Line 2
Line 3
``` 4. Save Expected result: have new lines after
tags (add them if not existing), like above Actual result: ```
Some text
Line 2
Line 3
``` This breaks visibility, makes maintenance harder (lines are longer in real life pages) Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Enter counts unmatched commented braces
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.15-Insiers
- OS Version: macOS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Write `\\ {` in a JavaScript file
2. Press Enter at the end of line
3. Next line indents ,however it should not.
